wikipedia_page.main: Robert Richardson-Gardner (15 June 1827 – 4 January 1898) was a British barrister, militia officer and Conservative politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1874 to 1890. He was also a Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London.

response: In 1905, his residence was 34 Grosvenor Square in the Mayfair district of London, England, the former home of Sir George Beaumont, 7th Baronet and Robert Richardson-Gardner,Illustrated London News 1898 and Northaw House in Northaw, Hertfordshire.
